SCRIPT.MSCRI:
! Add read action, URL and username to java arguments : SET &UC4RB_PUP_CMD# = "java -jar &UC4RB_PUP_PATH_JAR#" : SET &UC4RB_PUP_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_PUP_CMD#, " -action &ACTION_NAME#")
: SET &UC4RB_PUP_ESCAPED_STRING# = &UC4RB_PUP_BASE_URL# : INC PCK.AUTOMIC_PUPPET_PUPPET.PUB.INCLUDE.ESCAPE_ARG_VALUE : SET &UC4RB_PUP_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_PUP_CMD#, " -baseurl &UC4RB_PUP_ESCAPED_STRING#")
: SET &UC4RB_PUP_ESCAPED_STRING# = &UC4RB_PUP_USERNAME# : INC PCK.AUTOMIC_PUPPET_PUPPET.PUB.INCLUDE.ESCAPE_ARG_VALUE : SET &UC4RB_PUP_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_PUP_CMD#, " -username &UC4RB_PUP_ESCAPED_STRING#")
! Load package parameters : INC PCK.AUTOMIC_PUPPET_PUPPET.PUB.INCLUDE.LOAD_PCK_PARAMETERS
! Add read timeout, connection timeout and apiversion to java arguments : SET &UC4RB_PUP_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_PUP_CMD#, " -readtimeout &UC4RB_PUP_READ_TIMEOUT#") : SET &UC4RB_PUP_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_PUP_CMD#, " -connectiontimeout &UC4RB_PUP_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT#") : SET &UC4RB_PUP_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_PUP_CMD#, " -apiversion &UC4RB_PUP_API_VERSION#")

DOCU_Docu.DOC: This include is used add arguments which are common for all actions.This along with action specific arguments are passed to the java command while calling the JIRA tool jar. It can be used for both Windows and Unix environment
